sen.j: 歓喜光寺の開山である聖戒は、宗祖一遍の高弟で、一遍の諸国巡礼に随伴した僧であり、一遍の実弟ともいわれている。
sen.e: Kankiko-ji Temple's founding priest Shokai was a leading disciple of sect founder Ippen who accompanied him on his pilgrimage throughout various provinces and is also said to have been Ippen's younger brother.

sen.j: 『弥阿上人行状』等によると（「弥阿上人」は聖戒のこと）、歓喜光寺は正応4年（1291年）、綴喜郡八幡（現・京都府八幡市）に善導寺として創建されたという。
sen.e: According to sources such as "Mia Shonin Gyojo" ('Mia Shonin' being Shokai), Kankiko-ji Temple was founded under the name Zendo-ji Temple at Yawata, Tsuzuki County (present-day Yawata City, Kyoto Prefecture) in 1291.

According to sources such as "Mia Shonin Gyojo"(Documents about Mia Shonin ('Mia Shonin' being Shokai)), Kankiko-ji Temple was founded under the name Zendo-ji Temple at Yawata, Tsuzuki-gun County (present-day Yawata City, Kyoto Prefecture) in 1291.

sen.j: 石清水八幡宮に近いこの地が寺地として選ばれたのは、八幡神の本地を阿弥陀如来とする信仰による。
sen.e: This temple site close to Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine was selected due to the belief that Amida Nyorai is the Buddhist form of the Shinto deity Hashiman.

sen.j: 一遍が八幡神に帰依し、弘安9年（1286年）石清水八幡宮に参詣したことは『一遍上人絵伝』巻九にも見える。
sen.e: Ippen was a devout believer in Hachiman and it is recorded in "Ippen Shonin E-den" that he visited Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine in 1286.

sen.j: それから数年後の正安元年（1299年）、寺は関白九条忠教の庇護のもと、六条東洞院（現・京都市下京区）の源融（みなもとのとおる）左大臣の旧跡（六条河原院）へ寺地を移すとともに、菅原是善（菅原道真の父）の旧邸（現・京都市上京区堀松町）の天満宮とその神宮寺である歓喜寺を合併した。
sen.e: Several years later in 1299, the temple was relocated to the site of Minister of the Left MINAMOTO no Tooru's residence (Rokujo Kawara-in) in Rokujo Higashinotoin (present-day Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City) due to the patronage of Kanpaku (chief advisor to the ermperor) Tadanori KUJO, and merged with the Tenman-gu Shrine and its attached temple at the former residence (in present-day Horimatsu-cho, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City) of SUGAWARA no Koreyoshi (the father of SUGAWARA no Michizane).

sen.j: 応仁の乱の後、寺は高辻烏丸（現・京都市下京区）に移転し、さらに天正年間（1573 - 1592）に豊臣秀吉によって四条京極へ移転させられて、近世を通じて同地にあった。
sen.e: After the Onin War, the temple was moved to Takatsuji Karasuma (present-day Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City) before being relocated again between 1573 and 1592 by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI to Shijo Kyogoku where it stood throughout the early modern period.

sen.j: 法国寺は後陽成天皇の母・勧修寺晴子が、父・勧修寺晴秀（かじゅうじはれみぎ）の追善のために建てた寺で、当初「豊国寺」と称したが、豊臣秀吉の没後、徳川家をはばかって「法国寺」に改称したという。
sen.e: Hokoku-ji Temple was constructed by Emperor Go-Yozei's mother Haruko KAJUJI as a memorial to his father Haremigi KAJUJI and its name was originally written using a different character for the word "ho" but given its current name after the death of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI so as not to give the Tokugawa family a bad impression.
